pageContext.claim: “Illegal border crossings, and this is without the wall, before the wall, have decreased by more than 75 percent, a historic and unprecedented achievement.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to the decline in apprehensions along the Southwest border, from December 2016 through April 2017. Indeed, apprehensions have declined dramatically, despite seasonal trends. While the decline can be attributed in part to his anti-illegal immigration rhetoric on the campaign trail, the numbers are less impressive when you compare them to the first full month under the Trump presidency. From February 2017 (the first full month of his presidency) through May 17, apprehensions only declined 15 percent.
